definition: to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning

sentences.english: While modernity makes greater progress, it also brings with it a lot of malaises.
sentences.chinese: 现代性取得了巨大成就的同时，也带了诸多的隐忧。

sentences.english: But the advertising revenue has declined for two consecutive quarters.
sentences.chinese: 但是，连续二季的广告收入出现负成长，出现隐忧。

sentences.english: The anger of laid-off workers has long been one of officialdom's biggest worries.
sentences.chinese: 下岗职工的愤怒长期以来一直是官场最大的隐忧之一。

sentences.english: But there are concerns that the environmental impacts are being overlooked.
sentences.chinese: 但同时也存在着隐忧，环境上的影响正被忽略。

sentences.english: The delay will be a worry for all concerned.
sentences.chinese: 对所有关注的人来说，这一延迟都是一个隐忧。

sentences.english: China merely put its programme on hold to assess safety concerns.
sentences.chinese: 中国仅仅是搁置其计划来评估其安全隐忧。

sentences.english: The new HPR and the pilot property tax rules were the key concerns of the property market in early 2011.
sentences.chinese: 年初，新限购令以及房产税成为市场的主要隐忧。

definition: a danger concealed within sth/hidden damage/misfortune not visible from the surface
(lit.) to hold sb by the elbow/(fig.) to hold back/to impede/to handicap
doubts and suspicions/a maze of doubts/puzzle/mystery
root of the trouble/cause of the ruin
